description: The good-looking English actor looked sharp in a shiny black suit with white shirt and black tie and like any well-bred gentleman, he wore a folded white handkerchief in his breast pocket.
title: Tom Hiddleston heads to Jimmy Kimmel Live! in Hollywood
title_page: Tom Hiddleston heads to Jimmy Kimmel Live! in Hollywood | Daily Mail Online
text:
He's earned a reputation as a bit of a hunk and Tom Hiddleston certainly turned heads in Hollywood on Thursday as he headed to Jimmy Kimmel Live!
The English actor looked like he'd stepped straight out of Resevoir Dogs in his slick suit and shades as he strutted along with confidence.
Tom looked sharp in a shiny black suit with white shirt and black tie and like any well-bred gentleman, he wore a folded white handkerchief in his breast pocket.
Scroll down for video
Hey good lookin'! Tom Hiddleston was a sight for sore eyes as he headed to Jimmy Kimmel Live! on Thursday in Hollywood
Suited and booted: Tom looked like he was chanelling a character from Reservoir Dogs
Tom looked like he was chanelling a character straight out of Reservoir Dogs, the 1992 crime thriller that depicts the events of a botched diamond heist.
The rangy star of The Night Manager is in town promoting his latest big screen adventure Kong: Skull Island.
The action-packed great ape movie stars Hiddleston as the leader of a team of explorers who discover more than they bargained for on an uncharted Pacific island.
The actor, who made headlines with his short-lived romance with Taylor Swift last summer, wore his reddish hair gelled back from his forehead.
Perfect gent: The rangy English actor looked sharp in a shiny black suit with white shirt and black tie and he wore a folded white handkerchief in his breast pocket
Englishman in LA: He strolled nonchalantly along to Kimmel's studio on Hollywood Boulevard with one hand in his trouser pocket and sporting stubble and Ray-Bans
Publicity tour: Hiddleston happily waved to fans as he continued to promote his new movie Kong: Skull Island which opens in theatres on Friday
He strolled nonchalantly along to Kimmel's studio on Hollywood Boulevard with one hand in his trouser pocket and used the other one to wave to fans.
Just 24 hours earlier, he had also greeted fans at the Los Angeles premiere for Kong: Skull Island where he was joined by his co-star Brie Larson.
The pair signed autographs and giggled as they posed for photos together.
It's the latest stop on their promotional tour for the movie that has taken them to London, Mexico City, New York and LA in the past week.
The film which also stars Samuel L. Jackson, John C. Reilly and John Goodman opens Friday.
On screen partners: On Wednesday night, Hiddleston, wearing another sharp suit, was joined by co-star Brie Larson for the film's premiere of Los Angeles
